description: An unassigned player that gets re-rolled upon next login.
You start off as a novice fighter.  A Novice class adventurer is quite
capable of defeating any of the toughest creatures, but you are not
eligible to engage other player classes yet.
Upon reaching level 50, you will be given a new title, which grants you all
the rights & privileges worthy of a Fighter adventurer.
Enjoy your stay here.  And please visit often enough to keep your character,
and the rest of the competition, alive and healthy.  If for whatever reason
you cannot play for a stretch of time, this system automatically deactivates
your character.  If this should ever happen, just sign on when you can
and your character will reactivate.
The Alchemist depends greatly on the ability to use poisons.  This skill
enables applying 4x the poison value yielding the greatest effect on a
weapon.  Without that aid, the Alchemist leaves much to be desired as far
as natural fighting skills are concerned.  Being a creature of science,
this class does not buy any magical device.  The Alchemist may, however,
resist the effects of a spell or magical device.  Alchemists receive
an extra bonus in Intellect per experience level.
A ninja-style fighter, the Assassin has extra fighting ability making them
tough to defeat.  With the use of poisons and backstabs, the Assassin will
usually have enough firepower to defeat any fighting class.  Assassins
receive an extra bonus in Agility per experience level.
The strongest, combat-class fighter in the game, but the most susceptible
to the effects of magic.  As the Barbarian grows in experience, hitting
power augments.  There will be a point where a Barbarian's essence can
match the power of any crafted weapon.  Barbarians receive extra bonuses
in Stamina per experience level.
The Bard-class enjoys every aspect of the game: backstabbing, magic,
stealing, and fighting.  However, the Bard does not specialize in any
ability, thus the experiences can be either rewarding or frustrating.
An entertainer by trade, Bards receive extra bonuses in Charisma per
experience level.
A Cleric has good combat and magic abilities, but honing skills are
typically less than average.  Clerics receive extra bonuses in Charisma
per experience level.
Fighters are excellent killers.  Their extra-ordinary combat ability makes
them difficult opponents.  Though their class has no extra abilities, there
are no extra penalties levied against them either.  Fighters receive extra
bonuses in Stamina per experience level.
Jesters are annoying pests.  They lack serious hand-to-hand combat power,
but their acrobatic-like abilities gives them edge in dodging attacks.
Jesters also possess some magic, backstabbing, and thieving abilities.
Jesters receive extra bonuses in Dexterity per experience level.
The Magician is the opposite of the Fighter; powerful magic opposed to
combat abilities.  Magicians can consistently cast spells effectively and
yield better results.  Magicians receive extra bonuses in Intellect per
experience level.
Rangers are great survivors, because they must depend on their ability to
live off the land.  Like Bards, they have many special abilities, though
they do not excel at any particular one.  Their fighting and healing powers
are among their best abilities.  Rangers receive an extra bonus in Strength
per experience level.
A Rogue is similar to a Thief, but with some magic and backstab.
Their advantage lies within honed abilities and use of magic scrolls.
Rogues can achieve better than average abilities, as such, they
receive extra bonus in all abilities per experience level.
The weakest combat-class is the Sage.  While hand-to-hand abilities leave
much to be desired, spell casting abilities can dominate any class,
mortal or divine, as the Sage grows in experience.  Sages receive extra
bonuses in Intellect per experience level.
The Thief class relies on the ability to stealth approach an enemy and
deliver a powerful backstab.  Without it, the Thief is quite ordinary.
A thief picks pockets and robs other users most effectively.  Thieves
chief ability is Agility and therefore receive extra bonuses in Agility
per experience level.
A Paladin class can only be achieved by becoming immortal (100th level) and
solving the Ancient Riddle of the Keys.  A Paladin is the lowest class of
the superbeings.  Paladins have good combat abilities coupled with the use
of magic scrolls.  Paladins receive an extra bonus in all abilities per
experience level.
You can only ascend to a Titan class from immortalizing a Paladin class and
again solving the Ancient Riddle of the Keys.  A Titan is the second class
of the superbeings.  Titans have Fighter combat abilities coupled with a
Magician's use of spells.  A Titan receives an extra bonus in all abilities per
experience level.
The highest superbeing of them all, you can only ascend to a God from a
Titan class.  Gods have what is best in a Barbarian's strength and the
spell-casting power of a Sage.  A God receives an extra bonus in all
abilities per experience level.
A scary and vicious animal.
A supernatural and malevolent entity conjured or controlled.
A large, serpent-like creature possessing legendary powers.
A stealth predator with strong defenses.
A lesser demon with supernatural abilities.
A corpse reanimated by supernatural forces.
A large, hideous, man-like being that eats players.
